resources.string:
"Supported operations: +, -, /, *, ^, (, ), sqrt(), ln(), sin(), cos(), tan(), arcsin(), arccos(), and arctan().
" "
In order to take the nth root of a number or expression, you must use exponents.
" "The same goes for fractional powers.
" "For example, to input the expression: cube root of x, instead of cbrt(x) use x^(1/3).
" "To input the expression: cube root of x squared, use x^(2/3).
" "
For the trigonometric functions csc(x), sec(x), and cot(x) (and their inverses), you must use exponents.
" "For example, to input the expression: cosecant of x, instead of csc(x) use sin(x)^(-1)
" "To input the expression: inverse cotangent of x, instead of arccot(x) use arctan(x^(-1))
" "
To specify the x value where you want to find the tangent line of a curve use the input {x-value}|{function}
" "Similarly, to find the logarithm of a value, you must specify the base and the value in the same way: {base}|{expression}
" "For example, to find the tangent line of x^3 at x = 2, input 2|x^3" "To find the value of log base 2 of 6, input 2|6
" "
To find the definite integral of a function, you must specify the bounds of integration using the input:
" "				{left_bound}:{right_bound}|{function}
" "For example, to find the definite integral of x^3 on (2, 4), input 2:4|x^3 

" "
Each operator should work with the inputted expression. An error is (probably) the result of user input or an issue with decimals."
